nodes.bodyText: Why * is added here? It should work without the star.
Otherwise IntelliJ IDEA doesn't resolve next instruction !.idea/icon.png and show similar warning:
I agree with @vlsi. If you add the asterisk *, commands like git status -s -u will show you numerous other files under .idea folders across the repo.

@sbrannen , I'm afraid you are not quite right.
git status -s -u does not show extra files in .idea folder.
I've just opened gitignore documentation, and the star is indeed a way to go: https://git-scm.com/docs/gitignore

/foo/*
!/foo/bar
Hmmm..... strange... on my machine, git status -s -u was showing me numerous other files after applying this PR.

Cannot reproduce (gitignore works as documented):
$ git log -1
commit bc912a7754d25583ee6f11c7e801bdbaf08cf0af (HEAD -> pr2240)
Author: Victor Turansky <victor.turansky@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Apr 5 15:26:28 2020 +0300

    Add icon for JetBrains Toolbox
$ git status -s -u
?? .editorconfig
?? git_objects_by_size.sh

$ ls -la | grep '.idea'
drwxr-xr-x   16 vladimirsitnikov  staff    512  5 апр 16:04 .idea

I have st as an alias for status -s -u, and I'm using Hub that allows me to pull down a PR via am -3 <URL>. So with that in mind, here's what happens on my machine.
[junit5 (master)]$ git pull
Already up to date.
[junit5 (master)]$ git st
[junit5 (master)]$ git am -3 https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/pull/2240
Applying: Add icon for JetBrains Toolbox
[junit5 (master)]$ git st
?? documentation/.idea/.name
?? documentation/.idea/compiler.xml
?? documentation/.idea/copyright/profiles_settings.xml
?? documentation/.idea/gradle.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__com_assembla_scala_incubator_graph_core_2_11_1_9_1.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__de_schauderhaft_degraph_degraph_check_0_1_3.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__de_schauderhaft_degraph_degraph_core_0_1_3.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__junit_junit_4_12.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__net_sf_jopt_simple_jopt_simple_5_0_2.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__org_apache_logging_log4j_log4j_api_2_6_1.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__org_apache_logging_log4j_log4j_core_2_6_1.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__org_apache_logging_log4j_log4j_jul_2_6_1.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__org_apache_maven_surefire_common_java5_2_19_1.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__org_apache_maven_surefire_surefire_api_2_19_1.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__org_assertj_assertj_core_3_4_1.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__org_hamcrest_hamcrest_all_1_3.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__org_hamcrest_hamcrest_core_1_3.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__org_mockito_mockito_core_1_10_19.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__org_objenesis_objenesis_2_1.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__org_opentest4j_opentest4j_1_0_0_M1.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__org_ow2_asm_asm_5_0_3.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__org_scala_lang_modules_scala_parser_combinators_2_11_1_0_3.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__org_scala_lang_modules_scala_xml_2_11_1_0_3.xml
?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__org_scala_lang_scala_library_2_11_6.xml

?? documentation/.idea/libraries/Gradle__org_scalatest_scalatest_2_11_2_2_4.xml

?? documentation/.idea/misc.xml
?? documentation/.idea/modules.xml
?? documentation/.idea/vcs.xml
?? documentation/.idea/workspace.xml
🤔
It is strange that you have multiple .idea directories. Typically the one in the root is enough.

TBH, I don't actively use IDEA, but I obviously imported some projects into IDEA at some point, and that's simply what's in the file system.
In any case, isn't is possible to craft the patterns so that they apply to .idea directories in subdirectories as well?

I obviously imported some projects into IDEA at some point, and that's simply what's in the file system.

In this case IDEA will download Gradle for you  (possibly incompatible with your root project) and root project settings will not be applied to your subproject.
For example documentation isn't separate project.

In any case, isn't is possible to craft the patterns so that they apply to .idea directories in subdirectories as well?

I guess not

Technically speaking, the following would ignore .idea everywhere, except it would keep /.idea/icon.png.
**/.idea/*
!/.idea/icon.png

Of course, it is up to you, however, I'm inclined that .idea from sub-folders should be removed.

I'd personally rather go with the more explicit (and IMO correct) patterns.

@sbrannen Done  :)

This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            !/.idea
          
          
            
            /.idea/*
          
          
            
            !.idea/icon.png
          
          
            
            */**/.idea
          
          
            
            **/.idea/*
          
          
            
            !/.idea/icon.png
